metadata.title: CVE-2023-31607 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue in the __libc_malloc component of openlink virtuoso-opensourcev7.2.9 allows attackers to cause a Denial of Service (DoS) via crafted SQLstatements.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-31607` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvirtodbc0 - 6.1.6+repack-0ubuntu5+esm1
libvirtuoso5.5-cil - 6.1.6+repack-0ubuntu5+esm1
virtuoso-minimal - 6.1.6+repack-0ubuntu5+esm1
virtuoso-opensource - 6.1.6+repack-0ubuntu5+esm1
virtuoso-opensource-6.1 - 6.1.6+repack-0ubuntu5+esm1
virtuoso-opensource-6.1-bin - 6.1.6+repack-0ubuntu5+esm1
virtuoso-opensource-6.1-common - 6.1.6+repack-0ubuntu5+esm1
virtuoso-server - 6.1.6+repack-0ubuntu5+esm1
virtuoso-vad-bpel - 6.1.6+repack-0ubuntu5+esm1
virtuoso-vad-conductor - 6.1.6+repack-0ubuntu5+esm1
virtuoso-vad-demo - 6.1.6+repack-0ubuntu5+esm1
virtuoso-vad-isparql - 6.1.6+repack-0ubuntu5+esm1
virtuoso-vad-ods - 6.1.6+repack-0ubuntu5+esm1
virtuoso-vad-rdfmappers - 6.1.6+repack-0ubuntu5+esm1
virtuoso-vad-sparqldemo - 6.1.6+repack-0ubuntu5+esm1
virtuoso-vad-syncml - 6.1.6+repack-0ubuntu5+esm1
virtuoso-vad-tutorial - 6.1.6+repack-0ubuntu5+esm1
virtuoso-vsp-startpage - 6.1.6+repack-0ubuntu5+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: virtuoso-opensource package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.1.6+repack-0ubuntu5+esm1').
